liquid.engine

Class FluidEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • liquid.engine.FluidEnvironment

  • public class FluidEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    Class creates all of the objects to be displayed in the SimulationPanel, including the obstacles, drains, sources, flow meters, breakpoints, and the particles themselves. Here, the velocities of the individual particles are also calculated and stored, then later sent to the Logger to be written into the log file.
    Author:
    Rafael Zamora

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the particle details for the simulation. This includes the radius, max count, and viscous strength.

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Method runs one step of the simulation.
        Parameters:
        delta - - time, in milliseconds, since the last call to update

      • addObstacle

        public void addObstacle(org.jbox2d.collision.shapes.Shape s,
                        float x,
                        float y,
                        float r)
        Method adds an obstacle of the specified shape at the specified coordinates and rotated r degrees
        Parameters:
        s - - shape of obstacle
        x - - X-Coordinate of obstacle
        y - - Y-Coordinate of obstacle
        r - - rotation of obstacle, in degrees

      • addDrain

        public void addDrain(org.jbox2d.collision.shapes.PolygonShape shape)
        Method adds a drain with the specified coordinates based on shape.
        Parameters:
        shape - - shape of drain; must be generated such that the position of the top left corner's Vec2 value is X,Y

      • addSource

        public void addSource(float x,
                      float y,
                      float velx,
                      float vely,
                      float flow)
        Method creates a particle source at the specified coordinates, and with the specified velocities and flow speed.
        Parameters:
        x - - X-Coordinate of source
        y - - Y-Coordinate of source
        velx - - X-velocity of source
        vely - - Y-velocity of source
        flow - - flow speed of source

      • getParticleData

        public java.lang.String[] getParticleData()
        Method gets the position/length of the velocity vector for each particle.
        Returns:
        - array of particle data in the form:
        'P (x) (y) (velocity)'
